comments: I'm using an old Samsung S5 and it's the best night camera of the many that I've tried. A good balance of noise and detail. Shame it can't boost the exposure a bit more...
The regular camera app is far more effective (even on regular camera mode). Do not waste your time and data downloading it.

Not intuitive and the night pictures in bright city scenes are not as good as the android camera app and it takes 4-10 seconds and I could not stop the shutter process. The 8-10 burst flashes of night shots result in a messy image each time of nothing usable. I don't see the point of keeping the app.

although the quality is low, it actually works. providing there is already some light around though, it works very much better then the default camera app which pics up barely anything. It gave me a picture that was clearer then I could see! So you deserve 5 stars.
Not great, also, discontinued according to the many ads

title: Night Earth free
description:
Do you want to see the Night Earth application in your own language? You can help with translation at https://github.com/jmgomezpoveda/nightearth-translations


The Night Earth map shows the lights that are visible at night on the surface of Earth. This allows:

‚Ä¢ Observation of human-generated lights from space and light pollution caused
‚Ä¢ Location of the spots with less light pollution, for better observation of the stars
‚Ä¢ Real-time representation of the Aurora Borealis and Aurora Australis (Northern and Southern Lights), along the representation of where in the world is currently at day or night
‚Ä¢ Real-time cloud coverage, to check where is it currently possible to observe the stars or the Aurora
‚Ä¢ Night photography (only in the website, coming soon to the app)

The brightest areas of the Earth are the most urbanized, but not necessarily the most populated.

Two versions of the night images are available, captured by NASA in 2000 and 2012. These detailed maps account for 437.495 images in total, as described in the Night Earth website (http://www.nightearth.com).

Features:
‚Ä¢ Watch the Earth at night from space
‚Ä¢ Zoom in as much as you want so as to see more detail
‚Ä¢ Search any location, or tell the application to focus on your current location
‚Ä¢ Switch to the day images and compare between the day and night images
‚Ä¢ Compare the night images captured in 2000 and 2012
‚Ä¢ Labelled night map, to better identify countries and cities
‚Ä¢ Track in real time in which parts of the world is day or night
‚Ä¢ Real-time visualisation of the Aurora Borealis and Aurora Australis (Northern Lights and Southern Lights)
‚Ä¢ Cloud coverage
‚Ä¢ Support for devices running Android 2.3 onwards and Android TV
‚Ä¢ Visualisation of pictures uploaded to nightearth.com
‚Ä¢ (new) 3D view and VR support
‚Ä¢ Additional features are coming soon

Cities tend to grow along coastlines and transportation networks. The United States interstate highway system appears as a lattice connecting the brighter dots of city centers. In Russia, the Trans-Siberian railroad is a thin line stretching from Moscow through the center of Asia to Vladivostok. The Nile River, from the Aswan Dam to the Mediterranean Sea, is another bright thread through an otherwise dark region.

Some regions remain thinly populated and unlit. Antarctica is entirely dark. The interior jungles of Africa and South America are mostly dark. Deserts in Africa, Arabia, Australia, Mongolia, and the United States are poorly lit as well (except along the coast and rivers), along with the boreal forests of Canada and Russia, and the great mountains of the Himalaya.

----------------------------------------------------------------

This is the free version of the application. For the version with no ads, you can refer to our separate "Night Earth" app (http://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.dreamcoder.nightearth). Thanks for the support.

Love Night Earth?
Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/NightEarth
Follow us on Twitter: http://twitter.com/nightearthcom
Access the Night Earth website for sharing your own night pictures: http://www.nightearth.com

If you like the app, please leave positive feedback. Otherwise, please tell us why and how can we improve it (support@dreamcoder.org). Thanks.

Deserts in Africa, Arabia, Australia, Mongolia, and the United States are poorly lit as well (except along the coast and rivers), along with the boreal forests of Canada and Russia, and the great mountains of the Himalaya.

----------------------------------------------------------------

This is the free version of the application. For the version with no ads, you can refer to our separate "Night Earth" app (http://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.dreamcoder.nightearth). Thanks for the support.

Love Night Earth?
Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/NightEarth
Follow us on Twitter: http://twitter.com/nightearthcom
Access the Night Earth website for sharing your own night pictures: http://www.nightearth.com

If you like the app, please leave positive feedback. Otherwise, please tell us why and how can we improve it (support@dreamcoder.org). Thanks.
summary: Map of the Earth at night from space, in 2D, 3D and VR.

title: Nice Night Clock with Alarm and Light
description:
Simple and nice night analog clock with alarm and modern metal design.
Night clock application can be used also as a night light.

Settings:

- To set up repeated alarm just tap on the alarm button - red color and select alarm time, to clean and cancel alarm tap again - button will change to green color.

- To change clock color swipe left or right.

 - Double tap to change the background from black to white/high brightness - night light.

- Tap to the center of the clock to turn on/off second hand.

- You can change brightness to save energy if the clock is always on.

Go to menu to 

- Turn on/off clock tick.

- Set time and date.

 - Set your own clock color.

FAQ: http://www.zdarma.sk/nnc/faq.htm 

See video for more information - https://youtu.be/kveKcgGJFSI.

title: Blue Light Filter ‚Äì Free Eye Care, Night Mode
description:
Blue Light Filter - Night Mode - Eye Care 
Do you find it hard to sleep after using the phone at night time? Feeling eye strain when looking at the phone screen? All of these things are caused by bluelight from your phone. 
According to scientific studies, access to blue light has a serious impact on visual cells and inhibits melatonin, a hormone that affects daily biological rhythms. Green light reduction has been shown to significantly enhance sleep quality. 
This is a completely FREE application. Night mode protect eye from harmful blue light from your phone and help your eyes don't get eye strain and give you a good night's sleep!
‚ñ∫ Key  Features:
‚úîÔ∏èThe application of free care for your eyes 
- You can reduce your eye strain easily with night mode. 
- It is very simple but very effective! You just need to start this application up. 
‚úîÔ∏èBlue light filter with natural color - The application's filters are naturally colored so you can read news, email, and surf the web clearly. Because this application does not obscure the screen.  This application only adjusts the color of the blue screen to alleviate the blue light that causes your eye strain. 
‚úîÔ∏è Allows select and adjust the desired filter 
- You can use 1 of 5 available filters
- The intensity of the filter can be customized
‚úîÔ∏èVery easy to use- The simple interface makes it easy to manipulate the application.
‚úîÔ∏èTurn on/off quickly and easily
- You can choose to turn on or off  the blue light filter on the status bar
- Besides, it is easy to turn on or turn off the blue light filter in the notification bar even if the application has been hidden
‚úîÔ∏èCustomize screen brightness-You can customize the brightness of the screen so that it is best for the eyes
‚úîÔ∏è Schedule automatic filtering  - Allows on / off night mode automatically. Make sure that blue light filter on all night to reduce eyestrain, prevent cataracts, prevent insomnia and sleep better.

‚úîÔ∏è Reducing energy consumption - Our night mode reduces power consumption for most devices. Use night model  to reduce electricity consumption while preventing chronic headaches and regulating circadian rhythms.

‚úîÔ∏èReliable application-No login required. We never collect personal data or share your information with third parties.

‚ñ∫  Advice 
‚óâ Pause the flashlight function before accessing your camera
‚óâ The screenshot will receive the effect of the application as screenshots so please pause the application when screenshots
‚óâ Please grant access to some functions!! They are completely harmless. 

 We are looking forward to receiving comments and your reviews. 
   	If you like this app then please give us a 5 star rating
Your assessments and suggestions are a great motivation for us to continue to improve our products.

title: Camera Night
description:
Shoot photos and videos in low light, at dusk and at night.  Ultra-long exposure in real time. Ultimate device camera sensitivity and simulation of night vision.

Two cameras in one application:

1. Night vision camera.
Night camera mode with maximum sensitivity. See more in the dark!

2. Bright camera.
A high-sensitivity colour camera for taking photos and video at night and at dusk.

The Night Camera is well suited for taking pictures and video of still objects. To focus the image, hold the device steady for a couple of seconds. We recommend using a tripod to get the best quality night photos.

To compensate for device shake and get a sharper image, you can enable picture stabilization in settings menu. In this mode, photo processing takes longer.

Functions are also available for both cameras:
* HDR
* Light
* Multitouch Zoom
* Touch auto-focus
* Manual exposure compensation

Night vision camera functions:
* Automatic exposure compensation
* Equalization of frame histograms
* Adjustment of image colors
